text: I’m confused. I am logged in and downloaded an app yesterday. My account email is in the list of beta testers however I have had no notification to download the beta version, are there any other instructions?
<@U0Q4720P9> you have to sign to become a tester - did you get a link such as: <https://play.google.com/apps/testing/package.name.of.your.app>

The account that the application is published on was used. Would that make a difference?
I have now added another gmail account, clicked on `become a tester` on the supplied url and downloaded the application. Now just waiting.
Is that all I should do?
if that other account first became a tester and then downloaded the app, he downloaded the beta version... and you still see the official version from the first account...
never mind that it is a developer account, I think you have to add it's e-mail to beta testers and confirm when you get the link in e-mail
any one app will exist in one mobile at time from the same package
Don’t worry it’s working with emails other than the one used to publish the app
if you using different flavoured app with different package name then its possible

Hi everyone
EditText losing content after scrolling in RecyclerView. Help me out guys
you have a recycler with a bunch of EditTexts?
Sorry, yes I've bunch of EditTexts
its loosing content because the layout get refreshed every time you scroll the view
And are you calling `setText` on the EditText in your `onBind`?
Initially EditTexts are empty, user needs to type on the edittext. So that I can validate it
<@U1VFKQWN7> if user types in edit text and scroll away from that particular edit text the edit text will refresh and user entered data will be refreshed
Is there any way to fix it?
so either stop it from recycling, save it’s state or use a listview
also why is it in a horizontal scroll? sounds like a usecase for viewpager.
<@U0548MM6B> I couldn't find anything on this, but is there a way from stopping a specific view getting recycled or just a view type?
also IIRC you can override something in the adapter
<@U0548MM6B> yeah I knew about "blocking" recycling by type I was just wondering if it's possible to block by id. It makes sense that you would need to override something to do that
there is a hack for id, but dunno anymore, I knew I was doing it for a while on our trailer list

Hey people. I was wondering if anyone here experienced that issue : Update gradle to 2.2, build your app and only '-unaligned.apk' are generated. But I read on stack that gradle 2.2 shouldn't generate any unaligned anymore... I'm pretty confused here since I had to downgrade gradle to 2.1.3 to generate apk

How would I go about setting up a `Staging` build that is almost identical to my `Release` build, using Gradle.
Right now I have added a build type `staging` in my `build.gradle` mirror of `release` but with `applicationIdSuffix “.staging”` and also a folder android/app/src/staging/res which makes my build use different app name and app icon.
It builds fine, but when I run it, it crashes, and using `adb logcat` I am getting this error, among other things:
```
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): Process: com.ahead_mobile, PID: 14149
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not get BatchedBridge, make sure your bundle is packaged correctly
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.cxxbridge.CatalystInstanceImpl.loadScriptFromAssets(Native Method)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.cxxbridge.JSBundleLoader$1.loadScript(JSBundleLoader.java:37)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.cxxbridge.CatalystInstanceImpl.runJSBundle(CatalystInstanceImpl.java:177)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.XReactInstanceManagerImpl$4.call(XReactInstanceManagerImpl.java:906)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.XReactInstanceManagerImpl$4.call(XReactInstanceManagerImpl.java:899)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.bridge.queue.MessageQueueThreadImpl$1.run(MessageQueueThreadImpl.java:74)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.bridge.queue.MessageQueueThreadHandler.dispatchMessage(MessageQueueThreadHandler.java:31)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:145)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at com.facebook.react.bridge.queue.MessageQueueThreadImpl$3.run(MessageQueueThreadImpl.java:196)
E/AndroidRuntime(14149): 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818)
```
So what I gather is that I fail to load some assets? It may be worth noting Im using React Native :slightly_smiling_face:
are the RxJava adapters and such already available for retrofit2?
I can’t seem to get them to work
that fails because it’s a different version
